Module org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi
Package org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi

Class RemoteFileDescriptorBase<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi.RemoteFileDescriptorBase<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RemoteFileDescriptor, RemoteFileInput, RemoteFileOutput
    public abstract class RemoteFileDescriptorBase<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Closeable
    A wrapper that allows a FileDescriptor be sent via RMI over AF_UNIX sockets.
    Author:
    Christian Kohlschütter
    See Also:
    subclass for sending s., subclass for sending s., Serialized Form

      • resource

        protected transient T resource
        An optional, closeable resource that is related to this instance. If non-null, this will be closed upon close(). For unidirectional implementations, this could be the corresponding input/output stream. For bidirectional implementations (e.g., a Socket, Pipe, etc.), this should close both directions.

      • getFileDescriptor

        public final java.io.FileDescriptor getFileDescriptor()
        Returns the file descriptor. This is either the original one that was specified in the constructor or a copy that was sent via RMI over an AF_UNIX connection as part of an ancillary message.
        Returns:
        The file descriptor.

      • getMagicValue

        protected final int getMagicValue()
        Returns the "magic value" for this type of file descriptor. The magic value consists of an indicator ("this is a file descriptor") as well as its capabilities (read/write). It is used to prevent, for example, converting an output stream to an input stream.
        Returns:
        The magic value.
